September 2020 Edition

Welcome to the Fourth Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Welcome to the latest issue of the Justia Insider. We understand that we're living in unprecedented times and have experienced increased stress during this pandemic. For this reason, in this month's newsletter, we have included tips to help ease your mind. Additionally, we don't want to miss this opportunity to thank you all for your commitment and involvement in our different projects. It is much appreciated. We want this newsletter to be valuable to you. Please share any feedback and suggestions to help us improve.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

LSA Promotion Campaign. We started and continue promoting our newly added product through multiple channels. This is an effort from different teams that highlights our coordination and responsiveness.

Google My Business API Integration. We released our integration with Google My Business API, and the first feature of it is to be able to schedule posts in advance. This will allow us to bring this service to even more clients.

PPC Calculator. We launched a tool that allows both sales and accounting teams to save time processing costs and preparing quotes for potential clients. At the same time, it lets us streamline our offer to clients.

JMonitor migration. You wouldn't notice this, but the system we use to monitor and detect service interruption in our systems was upgraded to a standalone environment. This improves our general availability and lets us address issues right away.

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

September 7th - U.S. Labor Day

Traditionally observed on the first Monday in September, Labor Day (the “unofficial end of summer”) became a federal holiday in 1894. Peter J. McGuire, a carpenter and labor union leader, came up with the idea for Labor Day to pay tribute to American workers’ contributions and achievements.

September 16th - Mexico’s Independence Day.

Often confused with Cinco de Mayo by people living in the United States, Mexico’s Independence Day is actually September 16th. The date marks the moment when Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, a Catholic priest known as Father Hidalgo, made the first cry for independence.

TEAM ACTIVITY

Justia "Pixcel" Challenge

A huge thank you to everyone who participated in the Justia "Pixcel" Challenge. We were absolutely delighted to have received 16 submissions! Our competitors displayed a considerable amount of creativity, talent, patience, and authenticity. After tight voting, Laura García was granted the second place and awarded a $25 Amazon gift card. With 15 votes, Ana Serna was crowned as the undisputed winner of our competition and the $50 Amazon gift card.

DID YOU KNOW?

Vasu Featured as One of the 2020 ‘Fastcase 50' Honorees

Congratulations to Vasu Kappettu on winning the '2020 Fastcase 50' award. Each year the Fastcase 50 award honors innovators, visionaries, and legal leaders. Vasu has been recognized for her innovation efforts, integral contributions, and significant initiatives to Justia and many other legal technology companies. We are so proud to have you on our team Vasu!

WELLNESS

Activities to Help Your Mind Relax

During these days of the pandemic that we are living, stress can easily get into our heads. To counter this, here is a list of activities that can ease your mind:

Join an online yoga class

Listen to new music

Watch classic films

Pick up an old hobby

Test out a new recipe

Unplug and read a book

Try a meditation app

Do some craftwork

Give them a try; they sure will help!

Take a Pause

One minute relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried.

Step 1: Set up

Find a comfortable sitting position.

Put your feet flat on the floor and your hands in your lap.

Close your eyes if you feel comfortable doing so.

Step 2: Think, feel, body

Ask yourself, "What am I thinking now?"

Notice your thoughts. Notice if they are positive or negative.

Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3: Focus on your breath

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.

You may want to say to yourself: "It’s okay. Whatever it is, I am okay."

Then just listen to your breath for a while.

Step 4: Coming back

Notice how your whole body feels.

Listen to the sounds in the room.

Step 5: Reflecting

Think: "Do I feel different at all?"

When you are ready, open your eyes.

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta & Jose Ramos
